comments.commentBody: There is a massive difference between the kind of stuff you are complaining about, and encryption.  Apple has encrypted data-at-rest in such a way that they cannot see it (and apparently neither can the NSA).  If that data is exposed it is because you are not using encrypted tunnels (for example) in your activities, or the destinations where you are sharing your information is not taking proper care from the end of that tunnel into their data centers...

You do opt in every time you download an update. Read the fine print in the agreement you are required to acknowledge and accept each time. And the apps ask for access because they use those sensors and features to function. Your "phone" is not a "phone." It's a sophisticated mobile sensing and tracking instrument. Didn't you get that memo?

But Apple, Google, et al are not the government. They don't have the power to take your freedom or fine you thousands of dollars. You have a choice to opt out of Google and Facebook, you don;t have the option of opting out of governments prying eyes.
While this request is a legitimate one, to law enforcement all of their requests are legit. Snowden has shown us that the gov't cannot be trusted.

And you think that Apple, Google, Amazon, Facebook, and the like aren't constantly invading our privacy? You don't even have to opt in to these services to have them tracking you. Every time my phone is updated, the software tries to install apps that I will never use, but that want access to my files, my phone's camera, my contacts, etc. For them to refuse a legitimate request from law enforcement seems like the height of hypocrisy.

So you apparently weren't watching closely enough to know that there really were not any mushroom drugs in the capsules.  Mulder altered his perceptions on his own; which by the way ties back to his original discussion with Agent Einstein on perceptions of reality.

No, actually, those four economists who used to be on the CEA handwavingly CLAIM that Friedman's claims about Sanders's program are not credible. Sanders makes no claims, other than noting that Friedman has done an analysis which they like.

The four economists provide no evidence because *they have done no analysis*. If they actually sat down and did analysis and published it, they would be credible. BUT THEY DIDN'T. Their letter consists of bare, handwaving, evidence-free assertion.

At least -- unlike the letter writers -- Krugman is trying to make some sort of argument in his post here. But he first claims that unemployment can't go below 4% (which, I am told, it did as recently as 1999) and then claims that the decline in labor force participation is due largely to retirement (which evidence shows is entirely false; participation is still down among the 18-55 years old age brackets). So it isn't a good argument.

Furthermore, Friedman gave a range of 2.1% - 5.3% growth. This is a perfectly reasonable range, and mocking the high-end number only is... deliberately misleading.

I don't know why Romer, Tyson, and Krueger signed on to this content-free letter. Goolsbee is corrupt; he's joined a hedge fund.

.
Leapy,

Roger Wheelock is a world traveler. They haven't built the province yet that can hold him. He's been to amazing places!

Just so you know (and anyone else knows, if they trip over this), I enjoy the 50%/78% and such ... when it's affectionate, as it is with you and Martin and many others. On the other hand, the Commenters who routinely disagree with me? I'd prefer that they not remark on whether they comprehend my input; they can choose to elide over whatever appears under my (fake) name!

I'm talking about the rude ones. Impolite. Nonhumorous, judgmental, generally-checkmarked. I could have just emailed this to you but I hope others will see that I don't hold grudges against any who fondly tackle my sometimes-strained paragraph structure.

This is a rebuilding year, whatever the platitudes of the NYY top brass. They stood pat last summer which cost them the division and largely stood pat over the winter. Aged, injury-prone veterans, the rickety OFers Gardner and Ellsbury, mostly mediocre young players and a fragile, modestly talented rotation will wear down the powerhouse bullpen, just like last year. One free agent starter, even a B-level commodity like Gallardo or Kazmir, would have made a substantial difference for the '16 season..
Maybe this article could be resubmitted to the Houston Chronicle and leading papers in the cities of all AL clubs.

The Yankees are still two or three years away from returning to those glory days. Once the big contracts of some of their elder statesmen are finished, they will able to move forward. We can't expect much more of a season this year than what happened last.
Did the Yanks move to Brooklyn (Kings county)?  Maybe that would help!

"the Metropolitans abandoned their hero Murphy; who got them there almost by himself."
Uh-huh. Cespedes and their starting rotation had nothing to do with it.
Kings County is never going to the final stage, seeing as Brooklyn has no baseball team.

Sports are funny that way. Last year the Yanks beat the Metropolitans, yet it was Queens that went on to the final stage, while Kings County did not. I have doubts either team will make all the way to the World Series this year. The Yankees have not put together a great team and the Metropolitans abandoned their hero Murphy; who got them there almost by himself.

Here's an idea: don't infuriate your longtime fans by forbidding them buying tickets on Stubhub and other markets the team doesn't control (which the Yankees just announced they are doing in the name of "convenience"). The incompetent management makes it harder and harder to remain a fan.

Canada works differently from the US -- for one thing you have a parliamentary system.

One thing to realize is that Bernie has not actually promised to pass ANY legislation at ALL. This is because he knows he can't get anything much through Congress in the next two years (and neither can Hillary). He's just promised to advocate for legislation. This really allows him to shoot for the moon with that sort of stuff.

The only promises he's actually made are stuff he can do in the executive branch, and they're pretty conservative.

Great reporting! Behind a sporting event are the most important values that we have of equal rights/opportunities irrespective of gender, race or religion. We should all be aware of this and how a sports event is sometimes the border between those that want to upheld what we have and those that want to destroy it. When you understand that, you will understand much better the wars and terrorism that Iran is sponsoring in the middle east.
As long as we can ensure a minimum level of compliance, then Iran should not be isolated from international events. Far better to let them participate and continually exert pressure to ever better compliance. Part of the pressure is to report how they digress, remind everyone why and this may help to give the average Iranian hope of a better future and help others see the light. This is fighting terrorism and killing with peace.
1 strike and your out. The Federation should be disbanded.

Preventing women from watching sports is bad enough; but several of these Middle Eastern countries don't let qualified Jews from participating in international sporting events as competitors, when they've qualified. Countries like that should be banned from international sports.

What's worse is that international celebrities in entertainment, sports, etc. show up to these countries for big pay days and appearance fees.
St. Peter's Square and St. Peter's basilica are part of the Vatican. People who haven't been there think it's one big museum.
But he is a Marxist. Thus he is a zealot for the most powerful religion in the world.

People like the Pope should pray and preach but should not intervene in politics. Time of Vatican ruling the world has lapsed. Trump may look menacing to many but I feel that he is the most practical person and politician who dates to call the devil as a devil.
This Pope is on a spree of visiting countries where elections are due. Instead let him take Italian citizenship and contest for its leadership. If he wins, Vatican can rule the whole of Italy.
catholics are canibals. They eat human flesh and drink human blood.
"cannibals" The hour is late.
What is a canibal?
I'd much rather have this Pope for our President, and I am an atheist
Well, they could jettison some of the gold.
Amen to that!
How many migrants has the Vatican taken in?

The Pope did the same thing to Italy.....trying to shame and guilt trip Italians for not opening up their hearts and doors to all migrants. When migrants drowned off the coast of Sicily/Lampedusa, he went to comfort the ones who survived with the underlying message that anyone who wants to reach the shores of Italy should be able to do so. And, Europe should welcome them all. The church could sell off its billions in assets and clothe and feed them all.....he like others are living in a make believe idealistic fantasy world.

Trump is a classic example of failure of american democracy, Just anyone with a babbling tongue thinks, he can be the president.That so many support him is not at all surprising. It shows level of desperation and frustration built up by the democratic system. the people elect a president based on his commitments in talk shows and debates. Once he is elected, he is not allowed to implement his policies as he is controlled by "non-presidents". Just look at Obama who is in power yet so powerless. He is just passing his precious time in office twiddling his thumbs. meanwhile america wanders rudderless. it's not funny. it is painful to see once mighty america plunging to its death. And everyone is busy debating as if that'all is needed to cure what afflicts america today
Hey the "wall" around the Vatican works.

People please, the Pope is not really talking about a physical "wall".

He's talking about a "wall" around your heart.

The Pope is talking about caring about people. People you've never met, and will never meet.

Trump, by my observations, seems mostly concerned about only one person.

I haven't heard anything really positive coming from him. It's seems to be mostly complaints about everything.

Great leadership isn't defined by pointing out problems, it's defined by solving them.

The "wall" is a fantasy solution to a fairly non-existent problem. I believe the facts are that border crossings are at their lowest in decades.
Oh give me a break. Throwing a stone at Donald Trump? How about throwing Mt. Rainer at him? Or better yet, Trump Tower?
For your information, it was Dante Alighieri who wrote that, not Martin Luther King.

Good Pope Francis has rightly inserting himself into the Republican presidential race by suggesting that Donald J. Trump“ is not Christian”.

The moral papal leadership is expected to take firm stand on moral issue, remaining neutral is not an option as Martin Luther King said "the hottest place in Hell is reserved for those who remain neutral in times of great moral conflict".
.
Pope is but reflecting well known observation "because power corrupts, society's demands for moral authority and character increase as the importance of the position increases" by John Adams, second President of the United States and a Founding Father of American independence.

We shouldn't have the Pope to tell us what Donald Trump is, we as Americans should already see that electing any person like Donald Trump would be the greatest and last mistake the we as Americans would make. The man is psychotic, irrational, and on top of everything, he imagines himself better than anyone else, just because your rich does not mean you are better than the poorest person on this planet. And another thing is what I have seen happen lately in these Presidential Races, they have become a disgrace, being President is about being a great leader. You're elected to protect all the people in the Nation; the Poor, the Rich, it doesn't matter what color or race or religion you belong too, every single person is equal to the other person, no person is above the person next to them or miles from them. It looks as if we are starting to become uncivilized, the Human Race is going Backwards instead of Forward.
The Pope needs to stay out of US politics. We can mess that up ourselves. He should stick to  what he does best and that is enriching the Catholic church by milking donations from poor people.
